entry.title: 近来的感悟
entry.content:
献给Lx

党章总纲规定：中国共产党以马克思列宁主义、毛泽东思想、邓小平理论、“三个代表”重要思想和科学发展观、习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想作为自己的行动指南

博主在此声明，博主以马克思列宁主义、毛泽东思想、邓小平理论、“三个代表”重要思想和科学发展观、习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想作为自己的行动指南。

本文若与党的章程不一致时，以党的章程为准

近来的感悟

不追求爱情，只追求情感联结

忠诚要对人，身上笼迷雾，暂无法理解

逻辑闭环，不一定正确，任何事情都是如此

将军指挥着士兵冲锋陷阵，士兵是战争的实际践行者，将军是战争的实际受益者。正如经济活动，普通人是经济活动的实际践行者，拥有一个小碗，能洞察的人是经济活动的实际受益者，拥有大盆。当组织实行经济政策时，大盆的人自然接的多。

假如金钱流动比喻为一条河流，赚钱就是站在河边接水，人一次能接的水有多有少，主要是由工具、策略决定的，如古代的驿站传递的方法、换个大盆、用机器运。此外，河水有泛滥的风险，部分人为了求安稳，远离河岸，这是正确的做法，但未必完美，我们要看上游有无水库，水库如何操作等等等等等等许多，没有人看得完，因此得依赖天意。

赚钱有四个阶段，许多人知道的四阶段都是错的，许多人想一步登天，最终老老实实地一步一步走

不要随意突破认知屏障，有反噬

哲学是一种人生态度、认知方法，宗教很有道理，天意不可违，迷信不可取

做事情，许多人只是上山并且半途而废，部分人达到山顶并且安居乐业，极少部分人下达山脚，此山之后的资源是属于第三者的，前两者生活差不多，但是第二者能说会道，满嘴空话，如果他是属于准备下山的状态，我们可以包容并且帮助他。

赚钱的策略很少人会告诉别人，只告诉你哪里有水源，不告诉你流下去的河道，水源一旦泛滥，反而是祸害。而河道总是少数人知道，其实并不复杂， 但很累

世界80亿人，中国14亿人，机会很多，敢于分享，但注意，点拨不是帮人开拓，而是指明可能的路线。

打工是探险，创业就是生死场。要么被架空，少人同情，要么很累，少人理解。

当机遇出现的时候，我们长期所学的答题没有任何效果，大部分人甚至不能看到有问题出现，小部分人看到了问题却不以为然，更小部分人看到了却不知道解决问题，因为从来不是他们所学的那样，极小部分人要么误打误撞，要么真才实学，在我看来，二者地位相同。

因为我们是人，人性总是不变的，需求总是一定的，历史是个轮回游戏，机遇只是换装舞会

所有的经济活动都是割韭菜，才能产生利益，没必要同情韭菜，他们要么乐在其中，要么不知道自己是韭菜，要么产生不了大的影响，要么是必须牺牲的对象，要么容易被转移注意力

淘金不一定赚钱，但卖工具等东西一定赚钱，许多割韭菜的行为都是它的变体

获取信息的沟壑被互联网填平了，但认知信息的能力越拉越大。此外，部分信息在山上，没有人修路，得坐特权的飞机，或者要留下买路钱

扩宽认知边界，当成了热门词汇，它身上的迷雾就越重，实际很简单，完全不复杂，但正如在迷雾中行走，迷雾塑造我们走的路，十分容易被带偏

我们与中国人相处，有中国人的一套，不要不伦不类，要革新，不要乱变

稳定是大组织的核心，许多行为十分正确，即使会引起道德上的不适应

如树木，顶部越触及阳光，根部越触及黑暗，这是现实世界。幻想中的世界，树木可以无根，人可以光明笼罩。

[TOC]

对爱情简洁一瞥——笑话

总

一个女人的黄金时间很短，她的青春年华最好的时间也就是18到28之间的这十年，那时间对于女人来说有些残忍，过了这几年，皮肤开始衰老，身材开始走样，漂亮的容颜很容易就被后来的小姑娘比下去，所以女生在选择伴侣的时候是有紧迫感的，她希望在自己最好的年华找一个最优质的最合适的男生跟她结合，希望这个男人能够长期保障她和子女的生活

对备胎的认知

但是天有不测风云，就算一个女人找到了最适合她的男人，也会面临失去的风险。这个男人可能变心，所以女人会有一个备胎策略。备胎就是说，人人在选择一个伴侣的同时，还会跟自己的追求者保持友谊的关系。这样既能保证自己对伴侣的忠诚又不会让追求者对自己失去兴趣，备胎的表现形式是友谊，动机是爱情，女人有备胎是一个很合理的行为。特别是在这样一个年代但凡长的不错的女孩子，都可能会有备胎。

就算你是备胎，也没必要生气，没必要觉得接受不了。因为这是一个现实，这是一个不受我们控制的事情，另一角度上来讲，也不是坏事，这说明你已经进入了女生的侯选名单，代表你还是有机会上位

那如何分辨自己是不是备胎呢，这就要看女生对你的的反应了，如果你跟女生互动女生会回应你，而且呢会主动跟你倾诉，你们之间的关系感觉很亲密，但当你想升级你们之间的关系时她却用各种理由拒绝你，不给你前进的机会，那你多半就是备胎了如果你是主胎，女生会关注你，对你有比较高的服人度，你对她的吸引力足够强，你会很容易推进你们之间的关系，这两者的状态是完全不一样的感觉，但是当备胎也并不能说明就是价值低，也并不代表没有得到自己喜欢的女孩子的机会，备胎其实从某种意上来说比主胎更有优势，因为距离产生美在，女生眼里在，优点可能比缺点要明显，只要适当的保持无需求

思维极端化与自我价值低——现象

很多男生之所以觉得自己不幸福，之所以找不到合适的女朋友，在恋爱上拿不到想要的结果，就是因为有一个不良心态，就是思维极端化，所谓思维极端，就是这个人他的这个世界里非黑即白，他只能看到一件事情的一面，多数时候都是坏的那一面而看不到事情好的一面，以致他不能合理地解决问题，心态出现失衡思维极端化的人总喜欢给自己下一些定性的结论，自己看低自己。

比如说你去搭汕妹子，失败一次两次之后，甚至说十次里失败了九次，然后你就会告诉自己我一无是处，我绝对不会成功，我的人生是个失败的人生，我的人生毫无价值，这时你就会处于一种心态失衡的状态，你就会发现自己特别对爱情失望

还有一种人可能是自己分手了，或是看到一些社会新闻明星献媚了，离婚之类的，跟他生活八竿子打不着的事情他就会说自己再也不相信爱情了，他就觉得谁和谁那么恩爱都分手，那这个世界没有真正的爱情了，他就不会去想别人的感情失败可能是因为人家身上发生了一些外不知道的事情，他就只想着自己看到的那一面，而不考虑自己没有看到那一面，最后得出一个结论:我这辈子找不到真爱了。

拥有什么样的心灵你就会去构建什么样的关系，他总是不信任自己可以做好一件事或者自己能够做到一件事情，比如他可能还很年轻，20多岁，不到30岁，但是没有赚到太多的钱，他就给自己一个结论:我这辈子注定一事无成找不到一个优秀的女朋友了，再比如他可能感情上受到点挫折，离婚了，然后就给自己一个结论:我是一失败的男人，优秀的女人是不可能看得上我的，他就是喜欢给自己下这种消极的定论，然后感觉自己被生活压得死死的，不知道前面的路该怎么走

思维极端化与自我价值低——原因

我们之所以会形成这种自我的低价值感，往往是因为在我们的成长的过程中，父母和老师通常特别喜欢给我们贴上一些言过其实的标签

比如说上学的时候染了个头发，老师家长就给你贴上一个流里流气，实际你可能很规矩，也不抽烟喝酒，只是染了个头发而已，但是他看不见你规矩的那一面，总是有人为你贴上这种消极的标签的时候，我们就很容易给自己一个心理暗示:我就是他说的这种人

人是思想的产物，你有什么样的思想就会成为什么样的人，当你把别人对你的看法移植到自己身上的时候，你就可能真的变成他们说的那种人，你说我流里流气，那好，我也不守规矩了。

当你长大成年后，父母老师可能不再给你贴标签了，但是你自己已经养成了随便给自己贴标签的习惯，你总是用极端化的思维去看待这个世界，那你会发现自己总是不顺心，感觉不到幸福，越是害怕失败越是难从这种思维的怪圈里面跳出来

思维极端化与自我价值低——解决方法

任何事情都可以从另外一个角度去挖掘到它的价值，当你感到失败开始认为自己没有价值的时候，你觉察到你开始有了这样的情绪，你很愤怒、你很哀伤，你很郁闷，这个时候你就要立马切断自己的情绪，先问自己两个问题，是什么事件引导了你现在这么难过，你对这个事的理解是不是全面的

比如说有的人破产了就会觉得自己奋斗和努力了这么长的时间有可能几十年，得到的事业房子车子和所有的财产瞬间都化为鸟有，他就觉得自己的人生一无所有了，于是自杀了，没错，这些物质是没有了，但是他真的一无所有吗，他就没有想过，自己这么年收获的经验、成长，思考事情的模式，还有交下的那些朋友，经历事情，家人，亲情，都没有被带走，他只看到了失去的，没看到自己得到的，所以心态失衡自杀

有一旬话说的特别好，人生，除了生死都是小事，当你的人生有了阴影，那你才会变得更加立体丰满，所以现在在爱情当中面对绝望的时候，你可能很难受，你可能很消极但请你捕捉到这种心态，然后对自己说:接受那些不好

可得性

我们都知道要吸引女生，那么可得性又是怎么回事儿呢，你有没有发现，在生物界很多哺乳动物都是雄性比雌性好看，比如，雄性狮子的脖子周围会长着，显得它很雄伟，相比之下雌性狮子就普通很多，没有进化出任何装饰，鸟类中，很多雄性的羽毛也比雌性艳丽很多，能打开屏的是雄孔雀，那雌性孔雀尾巴是秃的，一点都不好看

而我们人类却恰恰相反，女性比男性好看，女人有更光滑的皮肤柔美的身材，女人还喜欢喷香水，涂口红，无论走到哪都是一道亮丽的风景线男人就不一样了，而女人作为被追求者，反而进化出了许多吸引男性的特点，这不正是违背了大自然的规律吗，其实，这种现象非但没有违反大自然的进化规律，反而是顺应了自然

为什么呢，这是因为我们人类的大脑，人类进化出的这个大脑虽然帮助我们爬上了地球食物链的顶端，发展出了现代文明，但这也给女人带来了沉重的负担，我们人类婴儿，本质上都是早产儿，刚生下来的宝宝还都只是一个胚胎，如果等到大脑发育完全婴儿其实是没有办法通过狭小的盆腔出生的，所以婴儿在出生之后，就得继续在母体外发育，婴儿在三岁之前都走不稳，六岁之前基本是没有任何生存能力的，必须有妈妈抚养，而别的动物生下来就可以站起来，几分钟之后可以独自去喝水，觅食，人类的女人要去照顾出生不久的孩子，相对生存能力就会减弱，她需要有人照顾她以及她的小孩，不断地为她提供生存价值，比如，为她提供食物，帮助她抵御灾难和坏人，这样她就可以专心抚养孩子

为此女人进化出很多有利于吸引男人的特征，比如凹凸有致的身材，能让男人神魂颠倒的脸蛋，吸引男人持续为她提供生存价值，进而共同完成生育这件大事，除此之外，女人还进化了出了一个其他动物都没有的特征，叫做隐性排卵，只有在排卵期的雌性才具备生育条件，也就是说这段时期受精才有机会怀孕，一般动物会在排卵期有一些明显的表现，比如雌性猴子屁股会特别红那么雄性猴子就能判断出来，哪一只在发情期，但人类就不一样，排卵期的女人和平常没有区别，并没有什么特别的反应和表现，而且排卵期是不确定的，女人也不知道自己什么时候排卵，而人类的隐性排卵这件事情是最近一两百年才发现的

那隐性排卵有什么特别的作用呢，比如你想和女人生孩子，但是你又不知道她什么时候排卵，能不能怀孕，而你还得防止其他男人乘虚而人，那你肯定只能一直留在女人身边，持续与她发生性关系，为她提供更多的生存资源，直到开花结果，如果一旦中途放弃或者离开，她就可能没有怀孕或者生下隔壁老王的孩子，那就麻烦了，孩子是不是你的你都不知道。

那么女人在选择男人时就不单只考虑的是男人价值是否高，还要考虑男人是不是愿意持续的把价值提供给她，而不会中途离开，所以女人也会考量一个男人是否具备担当，有责任感等内在品质，一个男人愿意在女性抚养孩子的过程中保证她有足够的生存能力，这个意愿叫做男人的可得性，有些男生可能会说，那照你这么说，我的可得性很高呀，女生应该愿意和我在一起才对，这就涉及到了可得性和吸引力的区别

吸引力

假如有两个箱子，它又大又破，这个时候对你说:这两个箱子你随便拿走一个或者都拿走都可以，你会怎么想你肯定会想，我要这两个破箱子干嘛，关键对我没有任何用处对，这个时候的箱子对你是没有任何吸引力的

其实这就是我们和女生相处的第一阶段，如果你没有吸引到女生，你就拼命的对女生好，想把自己推销出去，那么女生就会有一种排斥厌恶的情绪，或者刚开始礼貌性的回应你，但是如果你再三去找人家，对方就会避而不见，拉黑或者躲着你走。

如果一个装有一万的现金，另外一个有十万现金，这个时候你肯定想把它们都带走，这是因为你看到了箱子的价值，这个时候问你:你要不要，随便拿走一箱你肯定会很开心，先拿走十万的这显然十万的价值更高嘛，对你形成的吸引力更强，又告诉你，如果你要拿一万的这一箱的话，你现在就可以拿走，如果十万这一箱，过二十年之后再来找我拿，这个时候你的选择肯定会发生变化，因为一万这箱对你的可得性非常高，你马上能够得到它，二十万对你的可得性太低了，你怎么确定二十年之后钱会不会贬值，以及二十年之后你又上哪里找呢

说完这个例子，你就可以知道了如果你对女生的吸引力很高，你的可得性就很低，也就是她很很喜欢你，但是呢你很高冷，不理她，没有给她一点希望，那女生就会在本能上阻止自己跟你进入恋爱模式，那如果你对女生吸引力很低，可得性高的话，那她就是压根不喜欢你，那你去找她，只会让她厌烦，所以我们需要用恰当的吸引，再具备良好的可得性，这样女人才会感受到一种平衡和舒适感，要跟你长期的在一起。最终决定女生选择的是吸引力和可得性的均值，假设你的竞争对手的吸引力是9分，但是可得性只看一分，那么均值就只有5分，而你的吸引力可能是6分，你的可得性也有6分那么你的平均分还是6分，女生可能在你和另外一个吸引力很强的高富帅之间做出选择的时候，她会选择你，这就是为什么在很多时候，可得性强的男人也有可能战胜吸引力强的男人。在追求女生过程中，我们始终要去维系吸引力跟可得性之间的关系，而且要明白，可得性是建立在吸引性的基础上

entry.title: 君主论
entry.content:
《君主论》是意大利政治家马基雅维利在1532年出版的一本关于君主权术的理论书，是拿破仑、俾斯麦、轴心国最高领导人的政治指南。

没有任何一本书的任何一个观点是完全正确的，我们需要思考它什么时候正确。

“马基亚维利在书中的阐述使政治的理论观点摆脱了道德， 而把权力作为法的基础，从而将政治学的基础由道德转向了权力。——卡尔·马克思

党章总纲规定：中国共产党以马克思列宁主义、毛泽东思想、邓小平理论、“三个代表”重要思想和科学发展观、习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想作为自己的行动指南

博主在此声明，博主以马克思列宁主义、毛泽东思想、邓小平理论、“三个代表”重要思想和科学发展观、习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想作为自己的行动指南。

本文若与党的章程不一致时，以党的章程为准

[TOC]

The Prince

A Brief Synopsis of The Prince

A nation-state can either be a republic or a principality, and either old or new. An old hereditary state that has been passed down the generations is easy to rule, but taking control and then holding on to a new state is difficult. The difficulty is reduced if you supervise it. A hereditary state, such as a monarchy, can be taken by destroying the entire royal family. This is what Alexander the Great did to conquer and hold on to the Persian Empire of Darius the 3rd. However, states that are used to freedom must be crushed. For those who are not yet princes, it is possible to rise to become one by carrying out two steps. Follow the example of those in the past who saw their opportunities and be well-armed. To keep hold of the new state securely, all resistance must be destroyed by using cruel, swift and firm methods. But then benefits to the people should be given gradually. The prince must win the favour of the people and dispel any hostility. But he will only be truly secure when he can raise his army to defend against all comers. Mercenaries cannot be relied on, and neither can other people’s armies. To be successful, the prince must read history, study war, and know his land. He must give the appearance of being good, but also know how to be evil. He could not be afraid to be thought of as mean, as giving liberally and spending freely will lead to ruin.He also shouldn’t worry about being thought of as cruel, as fear is one of the only things he can control. The prince should be willing to use cunning if needed, and deception if necessary. He may or may not be loved, but as long as he is not hated, he is secure. Fortresses are of little use, as even though they can be used to defend against outsiders, they do not stop you from being betrayed by your people. The prince must be purposeful, determined, and unwavering. He must clearly follow one path or another. He could encourage art and craft, commerce and agriculture. Entertain his people with spectacles and festivities, rewarding those who honors his state. Only capable servants would be used by a prince, and he could keep them under control. Anybody who flatters must be avoided.
Machiavelli claimed that the once-powerful princes of Italy lost their power not through misfortune, but by their inaction and indecisiveness. Fortune directs half of our actions, but the other half is left for us to direct through hard work, cautiousness and virtue. Fortune needs to be beaten and dominated. It is often like a torrential river that cannot be stopped, but during periods of calm, preparations can be made to control and minimize the damage. Machiavelli concludes by stating that a leader is needed that will follow the advice in the book to conquer Italy and free her from the barbarians.

Be Present

In 1453, Mehmet the Conqueror was nearing the end of his conquest to bring an end to the Eastern Roman Empire. After 57 days of siege, Constantinople fell to the Ottoman Sultan, signalling the end of the kingdom. As soon as the triumph was complete, Mehmet settled there and moved the Ottoman capital from Adrianople to the newly conquered city. Constantinople was now under the rule of a new empire with a different language, religion and form of government, but Mehmet’s action of settling there made his position more durable and secure. In fact, in Machiavelli’s eyes, not staying in the city has resulted in not being able to keep the city at all. In The Prince, Machiavelli declares: New states that have different languages and customs from those of the princes, are more difficult to maintain. One of the prince’s most effective options is to take up residence in the new state.By living there, the prince can address problems quickly and efficiently. He can prevent the local officials from plundering his territory. The subjects will be in close contact with the prince. Therefore, those who are inclined to be good will have more reason to show their allegiance to the prince, and those who are inclined to be bad will have more reason to fear him. Invaders will think twice before attempting to take over the state. The situation where a business or territory is required to contain different laws, languages or customs will bring with it many difficulties. What is needed to keep hold of them is considerable energy and a substantial amount of good fortune. However, being present in the new area is one of the greatest helps to achieve this aim. It allows a ruler to regulate, repress, and control whatever they feel is necessary. Machiavelli gives them clear advice that is still beneficial today, especially for either a politician who may have to deal with state departments, committees and think tanks all, or pushing in different directions with varying agendas, or a person in business who has to deal with various divisions which have different strategic goals or takeovers in the company which have existing allegiances. In these situations, you need to make your presence known not just once, twice, but constantly get hands-on so you can deal immediately with any challenges when they occur. Do not risk them increasing in severity by putting them off until later. If one is on the spot, disorders are seen as they spring up and one can quickly deal with them. But if one is not at hand, they are heard of only when they have become serious, and by then it is too late. In today’s world, being physically present is not always possible. If you have national or international responsibility, you can’t be in more than one place at once. Being present today means being engaged and informed to lead. You must make yourself available and be prepared to show the way to others. Many high-flying CEOs are up early sending emails and working late into the night; answering questions and offering their observations. Failure to be engaged, according to Machiavelli, spells doom. It is easy to get excited about the possibilities of the future that the main priority would be to manage the here and now. If today is not managed well, visions and dreams for tomorrow will never become reality. Machiavelli urges you to live for today, for the present rather than for tomorrow. How one lives is so far distant from how one ought to live, that he who neglects what is done for what ought to be done, sooner affects his ruin than his preservation. Louis the 12th of France made several mistakes, according to Machiavelli, when attempting to occupy Milan and other Italian lands. Not being present in territory with largely different customs and language was just one of them. King Louis entered into Italy at the request of the Venetians, who were campaigning against Lombardi and wanted an ally. By conquering Lombardy, Louis gained the friendship of many surrounding small States. However, instead of allying with them, Louis decided to partner with Pope Alexander the 6th, who was far more powerful. He decided to crush the small power rather than the large one, which led him to be alienated and weaken his position. As a politician and leader, the Pope had vastly expanded the power and territory of his Catholic church, and Louis the 12th had helped him do that. Machiavelli points out that by making others more powerful, you weaken your own position. Whoever is responsible for another’s becoming powerful ruins himself. By bringing in a foreign power instead of guarding against them, Louis the 12th made another mistake. Many residents of Milan that were not happy with king Louis were drawn to the Pope, felt against their current ruler. As he did not live in Italy, he could not quickly deal with these issues, and, as he did not establish any colonies there, he wasn’t able to increase his influence in the area. Eventually he ended up losing all his Italian territories.

Do Not Be Neutral

When the king of France, Louis the 12th, was threatening to retake Milan from the Swiss, Machiavelli was asked by his friend what advice he would give to the Pope at the time. Did he side with the French, the Swift, or stay neutral? Machiavelli answered that he should support the French. In his view, staying neutral when two others are fighting would lead to defeat for the neutral party. They have left themselves in the position to be hated by both sides. If one side has performed favors or they are old friends (as Louis the 12th was with Pope Alexander the 6th), then they may feel that they are obliged to side with them, and failure to do so could result in hatred. The other side would also feel contempt for the neutral party, as they will be seen as timid, indecisive, and not an enemy to be feared. As he explains in The Prince, by not throwing your hat in the ring and declaring which side you’re on, you will be at the mercy of the conqueror and will also earn the scorn of the loser. A prince that’s also much respected but he is either a true friend or a downright enemy. In other words, when he declares himself without any reservation in favor of one party against the other, this will always be more favorable than remaining neutral. It’s fair to say that Machiavelli was not a fan of neutrality as a policy, as it’s often lead to weakness. He identifies indecision as a destructive voice. In a leader, there is an obvious risk associated with picking a side, but to not pick a side is indecisive, unforgivable and eventually fatal. In his eyes, action is often preferable to inaction, even if it leads to eventual defeat. Princes who are irresolute usually follow the path of neutrality in order to escape immediate danger, and usually come to grief. That’s not to say you should just pick any old side. It matters who you choose as friends and as enemies, too. But in the event of your side losing, people will still recognize that you took a firm stand on the issue. By being hesitant, differing or just preferring to wait and see what happens in the situation, both the winners and losers of the conflict will regularly come to dislike you. It will always be more advantageous for you to declare yourself and to wage a vigorous war. If you do not declare yourself, you will invariably fall prey to the winner, which will be to the pleasure and satisfaction of the loser, and you will have nothing nor anyone to protect or to shelter you. If an issues needs dealing with, a decision has to be made, regardless of how uncomfortable or controversial it may be. You have to take a stand, otherwise, both the victor and loser of the situation will lose respect for you. The prince was respected most when he reveals himself to be either a true friend or a real enemy. The winner does not want doubtful friends who would not aid him when he was in difficulty, and the loser will not harbor you because you did not willingly come to his aid with your sword in hand. Postponing a decision should only be done if it provides you with a strategic advantage. Overusing this tactic, however, will soon show you is indecisive. Machiavelli recommends bold action as when all is said and done and the dust is settled. Indecisiveness may lead to finding yourself without any friends. So when following Machiavelli’s general rule on avoiding neutrality in your affairs, which guides could you choose. If you are able to avoid it, he states you should not ally with a side more powerful than your own. The reason being that, if they win, you may then be in their power. However, they have these scenarios since Machiavelli’s death that have questioned his judgment, as he may have overlooked the value of showing discretion as a leader. There is a difference between staying neutral due to a lack of courage, and stayed detached by being cautious. In world war II, two fascist dictators made a decision on which side they should ally with. Italy’s Mussolini (who read and studied Machiavelli) joined Hitler, but Spain’s Franco decided to adopt an official polity to stay neutral in the war. Mussolini ‘s decisive decision was the Machiavellian move, but it ultimately meant that he lost the war, which in turn led to his death. Franco, on the other hand, survived the war and ruled his country for another thirty years. His discretion when making this decision helped enable a continuation of his reign of power. When you have made your choice, whether you are ally wins or not, if they survive, they will be appreciative of you siding with them. If your chosen partner is victorious, they become indebted to you. If defeated, they may protect you until you can rise again and the bond of friendship between you will grow stronger. Despite generally taking a negative view of human behavior, Machiavelli does be a positive reaction in this situation, observing that men carry enough honor and gratefulness, to not immediately turn on their allies.

Be Feared

When discussing whether it is better to be feared or loved. Machiavelli talks with two great military leaders: the Roman general Scipio Africanus and the Carthaginian general Hannibal. Scipio was seen as a great commander and was held in high esteem by his men, but even though they respected him, they did not fear him. Machiavelli said that one of the implications of having such a reputation was that Scipio is limited in the range of actions available to him. Some military and political strategies and tactics he could not use, as it would damage his reputation, which was being a spotless among his soldiers and the wider population. While he was in Spain, the troops under Scipio’s command rebelled. This mutiny occurred because of the discipline being too slack rather than too tough. Scipio was not willing to punish them for their behavior. At the time when Rome was a Republic, timeless generosity and showing mercy was seen as virtues rather than faults. Scipio was forced to be merciful in this situation to keep himself popular as a leader. This led to his army not fearing him as much, and as a result they were more prone to mutiny. By enforcing from forceful discipline and instilling some fear into his men, he could have brought them under control. But he didn’t, and Machiavelli criticizes him for it. No prince should mind being called cruel for keeping this subject peaceful and loyal. Hannibal was described to the cruel leader by Machiavelli, who believed this character trait was an asset in his position. The general’s army was far more diverse with Scipio, and they travelled a further distance to foreign land. To avoid his internal conflicts and mutinies amongst the troops, a feared but respected leader like Hannibal was needed. In The Prince, Machiavelli argued that it was better to be feared than loved, and in this regard Hannibal had a strong advantage over Scipio. His ability to instill fear into his men and followers helped him to command a huge army and an expansive empire. Among the wonderful deeds of Hannibal, this one is enumerated: having led an enormous army, composed of many various races of men, to fight in foreign lands, no dissensions arose either among them or against the prince, whether in his bad or in his good fortune. This arose from nothing else than his inhuman cruelty, which, with boundless velour, made him revered and terrible in the sight of his soldiers. But without that cruelty, his other virtues were not sufficient to produce this effect. Being brave or good at your job as a leader or boss is not enough to secure the loyalty of your workers. Strength and discipline is required to keep them under control. Good leaders are admired, but strong leaders are obeyed and respected. Being over-compassionate enables unrest and disorder. This theory from Machiavelli have been used throughout history, from the likes of Genghis Khan to your typical modern-day drill instructor. Fear and intimidation has often been an effective means of motivation. In Machiavelli’s era, Cesare Borgia inspired fear by committing several cruel acts, but the eventual result was order and peace in a state that was powerful and United. Machiavelli points out that every prince would prefer to be thought of as merciful, but he believed the Prince should not mind being thought of as cruel. Borgia ‘s wicked behavior was, in fact, actually merciful, as through his acts of cruelty, he spared his people the even worse fate of political chaos. A prince such as Hannibal, who enacts cruel punishment, is not cruel, if his behavior helps to create stability. A Prince such as Scipio, who goes mercy, is not really merciful, if it allows turmoil and disorder to flourish, which hurts everyone. A limited number of the severe punishment will affect a small amount of individuals, whereas being excessively merciful can cause disorder which damages an entire community. A question arises: whether it be better to be loved and feared or feared than loved? It may be answered that one should wish to be both, but because it is difficult to unite them in one person, it is much safer to be feared than loved if you cannot be both. Because this is to be asserted in general of men, that they are ungrateful, fickle, false, cowardly, covetous, and as long as you succeed they are yours entirely; they will shed blood for you, risk their property, life, and children ,but when the danger is removed, they turn against you. And that prince who, relying entirely on their promises, takes no other precautions, is ruined; because friendships that are bought rather than achieved by greatness or nobility of mind, may indeed be earned, but they are not long lasting, and in time of crisis, cannot be relied upon. Men have less scruple in offending one who is beloved than one who is feared. For love with them is preserved by a bond which is easy to break at every opportunity to their advantage, but fear is strengthened by the dread of punishment, which is always affected. That was arguably the most famous statement Machiavelli made. It is also often one of the most misunderstood. Firstly, in an ideal world, Machiavelli said, it is better to be feared and loved, but the realism points out that the two do not coincide very often. Many take his argument that it is better to be feared than loved at face value out of context, giving the impression that it is simply encouraging tyrannical and dictatorial behavior. However, when taken in the context of what Machiavelli advocates as the Prince’s ultimate goal to maintain the state, we can see that this goal requires the people to be compliant, which fear helps to achieve. Machiavelli does not support using cruelty only to benefit the Princes. By using his power to protect his citizens, and by not interfering too much in their lives, the prince can be feared but not hated. It is important for a prince to avoid being hated at all costs, as Machiavelli believes it is deadly for a leader because hatred could result in them being overthrown by their subjects. Alternatively, if the people fear their prince, the fear act as a more powerful commitment of support. This is due to the people’s fear of what a lack of support could lead to. To achieve fear but not hatred, a prince must only be cruel when absolutely necessary and should not injure his people, nor should he confiscate their property. The threat of punishment should be made clear, as the leader that does so has a far easier time of keeping control of his own subjects. The people are more likely to comply so long as the prince does not affect their lives or their land. If he must impose discipline about lives being taken, then there must be a clear and obvious cause and proper justification. Machiavelli advises against the taking of people’s property, as he had the dark view of human nature that people would forgive the death of somebody they loved more quickly than the stealing of their assets. Men more quickly forget the death of their father than the loss of their patrimony. Girolamo Savonarola was a friar who became extremely popular in Florence. While he was in power, he was greatly loved by his followers. However, once his grip on power weakened, he was abandoned by his people. Machiavelli thought that humans are largely selfish and generally in it for themselves. They will only support a prince, if it provides a benefit to them. They will support someone they love a lot of the time, but once the prince’s power declines, the people can soon forget about Prince’s affection. In other words, when the going gets tough, the people will abandon him. If Moses, Cyrus, Theseus, and Romulus had been unarmed, they could not and enforced their constitutions for long, as happened in Girolamo Savonarola, who had no means of keeping steadfast those who believed, or of making the unbelievers to believe. The fear of punishment for people is a constant. The feeling of affection is unreliable. Therefore, when ordering rulers by their strength, the weakest depends only on love, a stronger commander inspires fear in his people and the strongest prince instills both fear and love. So it is important as a prince to behave in a strong and decisive manner, which may even involve being cruel but not to the point that the people hate you for it.

Never Bring Others To Power

The Romans moved into Greece and their subsequent treatment of the Greek city state was a prime example of how Machiavelli thought powers should be acquired and maintained. They were brought into Greece by the eolian. as Machiavelli stated, when a powerful foreign party enters the country, people that have an existing hatred or grievance with the ruling power are naturally drawn towards this new external challenger. Despite conquering large amounts of territory, the Romans attempted to appease the majority of the local people and keep down any potential challenges to their power. Several measures were taken by the Romans to ensure that they successfully added the land of several countries to their own region. Firstly, the Roman senate set up colonies and maintained friendly relations with weaker powers, such as the minor Greek States of the Achaeans and Aeolians, while at the same time ensuring they did not allow any increase in strength of the smaller States. Secondly, they ignored requests of friendship from the stronger kingdom of Macedonia, and when the Aeolians asked the Romans to help them fight against Philip V of Macedon, they accepted and defeated him, significantly weakening his powerful kingdom. Finally, they did not allow any other strong foreign party to gain authority. A few years after defeating Philip V of Macedon, the Aeolians were allied with Antiochus the third of Syria. The Romans did not agree to letting the foreign challenger Antiochus hold any state in Greece and turned on the Antiochus, defeating them, and Antiochus, significantly reducing their overall strength too. the Romans ensured that they did not increase the power of anyone but themselves. They conquered neighboring provinces and kept hold of them by following these policies. Machiavelli highlighted indulged the lesser powers without increasing their power to. put down the powerful. do not allow foreign powers to establish the reputation. This combination of acts would lead the Romans with more power than they had before, and every other group with less power or no more power than they previously had. So Machiavelli encourages princes to establish alliances, but warned not to make those allies too strong as they can and will turn on you at some point. when trying to establish himself in Italy, king Louis the third made the mistake of increasing the strength of one of the greatest powers there, by coming to the aid of Pope Alexander and the powerful church. Louis surrendered much of his power through treaties, and the church eventually turned against him. The king had already destroyed many smaller States, who would have been valuable allies against the Pope, and therefore failed to keep his territories. Machiavelli depicts power as a scarce resource. by acting in a way that solidifies your own power, You simultaneously weaken others. Conversely, by making others powerful is to weaken yourself. This is important not only in diplomacy but also in war. Conflict is inevitable. According to Machiavelli, political life is constant warfare, and the acquisition of power is a zero-sum game. Attempting to avoid conflict by appeasing another person and elevating their position is a mistake. your ally will see it as a sign of weakness and turn on you using the power that you’ve surrendered to them. If you have to fight, do it and get it over with.

Be Both The Man and The Beast

In Greek mythology, many ancient princes, including the three heroes Asclepius, Achilles, and Hercules, were nurtured and educated by a teacher that was half man, half beast. This creature went by the name of Chiron and was known as the wisest of all the creatures. Chiron taught the heroes how to act like men by using a keen mind, but also how to behave like a beast with a strong will to survive. Machiavelli used the metaphor of Chiron to illustrate his view that princes could use a combination of cunning and brute force. Failures to use both these sides of nature would result in a failure to survive. You must know there are two ways of contending: the one by law, the other by force. The first method is natural to man, and the second to beast. But because the first is frequently insufficient, it is essential to have recourse to the second. Therefore, it is necessary for a prince to understand how to take advantage of the beast and the man. The good leader must love peace, but also be well aware of how to wage war. Civilized people use the law to settle differences and disputes. Fighting by law is natural to men and involves using rational thinking and discussion, but the law does not always work in our favor and therefore often proves inadequate in such situations. Machiavelli declares it wise to behave in a more forceful manner to intimidate and frighten, enabling you to get your way. It’s all well and good to rule compassionately, but sometimes this proves insufficient, and arms are needed to procure your position to stay in power. When circumstances demanded, you need to act differently. It therefore may be necessary to resort to an animalistic show of forces. So it is necessary for a prince to know how to make use of both natures. one without the other is not durable. When a prince is challenged the nature of the beast, Machiavelli state that there are two different animal instincts that he should master and mimic. He should attempt to be both a lion and a fox. A lion is mighty and brave, so strong that he often doesn’t even need to fight, because his size and reputation can keep opponents and his own people at bay. however, it is an error to rely only on the lion, as it is not particularly crafty or shrewd, Unlike the wily fox. what the fox lacks in strength, it makes up for in cunning, easily being able to spot deceptions and escape trap. This is especially important in issues of diplomacy to avoid any potential pitfalls. A prince, therefore, who is forced to act like beasts, ought to learn from the fox and the lion; because the lion cannot defend himself against traps and the fox cannot defend himself against wolves. to gain power and thrive, A combination of cunning and strength is required. when civilized debate does not provide you with victory in the argument, arm-twisting may be necessary. however, too much force will see you viewed as a bully. Mix your strength with craftiness, cultivate them both, and use either when appropriate, to overcome any number of challenges. In the prince, Machiavelli appreciates that rulers need to behave differently depending on the circumstances. be cautious when caution is necessary, and be courageous when courage is required. Adaptability is important. The idea of taking context into account when evaluating an act ethically is key. Machiavelli did not advocate blindly following an ideology nor judging behavior according to absolute moral standards.

Destroy, Do Not Wound

Machiavelli States that princes can come into power by various different methods, by skill, by luck, through being elected by their fellow citizens. But princess can also gain power through criminal means, and in the prince he tells stories of two men who successfully achieved power by using wickedness. Agathocles was a poor, common man, born to the son of a Potter. He joined the military and through a combination of wickedness, determination and ability, rose through the ranks to the position of Praetor of Syracuse. Not satisfied with this, he decided he wanted to become a prince and called a supposedly crucial meeting of the Syracuse sensate. Once everyone had assembled, he gave the signal to his soldiers, who executed all the senators and rich men of the state. This act of cunning and deception enabled Agathocles not only to become king of Syracuse, but to control the state without any serious threat to his absolute power. He even managed to withstand a Carthaginian sieges on his city. A more recent illustration of grabbing power by evil means is the case of Oliver Otto de Fermo. Made an orphan as a child, he was raised by his uncle before being sent to military school. He was intelligent, strong, and fearless, which helped him become a prominent soldiers. However, he too decided he wanted to be a commander rather than being commanded, and arranged with his allies to take over the city of Fermo. Writing to his uncle, telling him he wanted to visit, Oliver Otto returned to Fermo, bringing with him his loyal soldiers. As part of his homecoming, he arranged the banquet, inviting many important nobles and local politicians in the town. After the banquet, Oliver Otto spoke in praise of the ruler Pope Alexander VI and his son, but mid-conversation his soldiers came out of secret hiding places and killed all the guests, including his uncle. After slaughter Oliver Otto went on to besiege Fermo and seize power, he scared the people into forming a new government in which he was the prince and continued to terrorize the city into obedient. Anybody that rebelled against him was killed. It was only thanks to the superior political skills of the Pope’s son, Cesare Borgia, that Oliver Otto lost hold of his power, and Borgia later had him executed. These two infamous rulers enhanced their power through the use of brutal, crawl and inhumane behavior. Agathocles ‘s courage and ability made him a prince and commendable in Machiavelli’s eyes, but his behavior was not virtuous and his methods lacked honor. In other words, he got the power, but not the glory, and therefore didn’t get Machiavelli’s true respect and full admiration. Machiavelli neither praised nor condemns the method of grabbing power through wickedness. He simply States that this tactic is criminal and dishonest, but ultimately works. ignoring morality and only concerned about efficiency, Machiavelli believed there are good and bad ways to be cruel, and sometimes force and violence is needed to secure your position as a prince. However, once that has been achieved, you must stop and let the situation heal. A good act of cruelty has to be done all at once, and then immediately end without the need for any further crime. A bad cruelty is one that becomes a messy business by requiring repeated criminal behavior. By continuing to inflict pain and suffering on the people, they will never support you. So it should be noted that when he sees in the state, the new ruler must determine all the injuries that he need to inflict. He must inflict them once for all and not have to renew them every day, and in that way he will be able to set men’s minds at rest and win them over to him when he confreres benefit. Whoever acts otherwise, either through timidity or bad advice, is always forced to have a knife ready to his hand, and he can never depend on his subject because they, suffering fresh and continuous violence, can never feel secure with regard to him. The long term success and security of the state was Machiavelli’s main concern. For this reason,
Despite using a similar effort to gain power, he believed the Agathocles’s use of violence may have been justified, whereas Oliver Otto’s was not. The former ended his use of force soon after he took control, established order and secured the state. As a result, the local population supported him, and they helped save the state against the attackers. The former’s evil acts saved the state and ultimately benefited the people. Therefore, for Machiavelli, the ends could justify the means. Oliver Otto, on the other hand, continued to behave in a cruel and wicked manner. Because of this, the people did not support him and did not defend the city against opposition. By being unable to save the state, Oliver Otto’s behavior was not justified and the ends could not justify the means. The ultimate goal for the former was the greater good of the state. The latter’s only goal was to better himself. Villains were able to hold power successfully by exploiting their crimes well. Failure to act swiftly and decisively will mean you’ll always have to be on your guard, as someone can be plotting against you. Machiavelli’s lessons for a prince is that, commit all your cruelties at once. A Swift, decisive strike is less painful than 1000 small cuts. Conversely, distribute benefits to people over time and in small amounts, ensuring they appreciated more. By giving out too much. People will expect more later. Violence must be inflicted Once for all. People will then forget what it tastes like, and so be less resentful. Benefits must be conferred gradually, and in that way they will taste better. Modern politics contains many figures that came to power, in ways that are Machiavelli’s examples. Many past and current national leaders have exploited people, committed atrocities, and maintain their power through deception and killings. In today’s world, cruelty and politics, they often go hand in hand. Machiavelli’s teachings can help you better evaluate today’s politicians by analyzing their cruel behavior. So how should a Prince conquer a new state? According to Machiavelli, he could eliminate the entire old ruling family. This will remove the greatest threat to power. In the Russian revolution of 1917. The Bolsheviks, led by Lenin, not only executed the emperor of Russia, Nicholas II, but also executed his entire family. One has to mention that men should either be well treated or crushed because they can recover from lighter injuries and avenge, but more serious ones they cannot. Therefore, the harm that is done to a man should be so serious that one does not stand in fear of revenge. This is ruthless advice from Machiavelli. It used his logical reasoning but lacks any consideration of ethics. His binary choice for leaders of treating people well for destroying them is clinical realism, as anything in between to create strong enemies. However, I don’t think it is always the correct course of action, even when taken into account the fact that his advice is specifically the leader……Athens imposed democracy on the rebellious land, and gained financially from their decision.

entry.title: 经济、哲学、政治
entry.content:
我们只能在认知范围内，看似合理地解释经济、哲学、政治现象，并对未来产生模糊地预测

必须注明，我对概念的理解不是很清楚，文章重实践，轻学术

理性在争辩中蜿蜒前进，欢迎提出批评。邮箱在最底部

党章总纲规定：中国共产党以马克思列宁主义、毛泽东思想、邓小平理论、“三个代表”重要思想和科学发展观、习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想作为自己的行动指南

博主在此声明，博主以马克思列宁主义、毛泽东思想、邓小平理论、“三个代表”重要思想和科学发展观、习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想作为自己的行动指南。

本文若与党的章程不一致时，以党的章程为准

[toc]

大航海时代

欧洲人发现了美洲富含黄金，而黄金对原住民并无特别重要的意义，但对欧洲人而言，意义重大，价值连城。为什么欧洲人这么喜欢黄金呢？ 因为欧洲与美洲不同，欧洲缺少黄金，一开始黄金的价值肯定不高，但随着它的使用，稀缺性逐渐出现，导致欧洲人认为黄金本身具有极高的价值

以欧洲的演变为本文起始点，是否不具有代表性？

我们谈欧洲，实际上也是谈世界，我并未经过论证，但感觉，经济在任何地域的发展逻辑都是类似的，只是可能由于资源、政治、哲学等因素延缓了经济发展阶段。

古典经济

后来我们认为之前所用的货币，虽然本身具有价值，但是它的价值只是表象，在商品交换的过程中，货币只是中介。除此之外，他们还认为决定商品价值的，是生产一个商品所需要的劳动时间。

这貌似很有道理，但是，当我们用浅薄而虚浮的理论分析实际的经济学问题时会发现很多反理论但是符合常识的现象。

不符合常识现象对我们有什么启示呢？

什么叫符合常识现象呢？首先，常识是我们共同认可的，具有社会属性， 也就是说，我们在与他人进行互动交往中，学习了常识。由此可以推论，我们对商品价值的认识来它与另外一个商品的互动。

商品的价值来自它与另一个商品的互动，但由于地域等因素，相同商品的价值可能不同。500年前，欧洲人以欧洲的价值体系，认为黄金具有很高的价值，但是以美洲人的价值体系，黄金价值有限。此时，我们假设欧洲与美洲存在一种商品A且价值类似，因此黄金在欧洲与美洲两个不同价值体系下，所对应的商品A的数量就不同，而同等的黄金交换商品A的数量存在不同，对应的货币量不同，这便产生了利润。

所以，商人不是单纯凭借交换东西赚取利润，他们是将同一商品在不同的价值体系中交易，产生利润，这利润往往是高额而不为人知的，而我们知道的低额利润往往不是反常现象，更多的时候是一种竞争策略

谈论这么久，那什么是价值呢？

价值不可知。为了描述清楚一个东西，我们通常需要类比，或者更加抽象的词语去描述，这两者都只是在内部绕圈圈的行为。康德曾言物自体不可知。如前所言，价值至少是两个物自体相互作用的结果，因此反而更加不可知。

货币是如何度量商品A的价格呢？

起初，我们常用有无价值类似的话语进行小规模的商品交换，物体由此确定了自身相对而立的观点，即一个物品交换另一个物品的数量是可以度量的，但我们依旧无法直观确认商品的价值是什么意思，我们交换仅仅出于需要的念头与过往的偶然的成功经验。为了便捷，货币的出现了，使得我们无法认识到的价值确定了，我们可以用货币衡量一切商品。许多认为，无价之宝不就是没有货币度量的吗？ 但是，无价，不是真的无价格，而只是由于社会因素导致的不愿意交换的借口，一切物体实际上都可以被度量。当然，因为度量而产生的价格不一定合理，但价格的存在是无可置疑的。

价值转化为价格，除了方便交易，还有其它作用吗？

价值的不可知不断转化为可认知的过程，便产生了我们消费的动力。在此额外说一点，欲望确实是消费的动力，但是过于抽象的事物，不将其实体化，是难以指导现实世界的活动，因此，我们将欲望撇去，着重于价值不可知。

许多人鄙弃农民工的蛇皮袋，认为他的价值很低，相反，LV包包价值很高。为什么？难道蛇皮袋子能装的东西少于LV包包？显然错误，那么肯定是他们所指代的其他含义，导致他们的不同。我认为物体所代表的社会地位占据更重要的原因。而它所代表的社会地位是不可知的，或者说，我们故意不言明的。一旦言明，即可知，我们对它需求的动力便会下降。倘若，LV的公然宣传社会地位高，这反而不利于它的销量，大部分人更会产生本能的厌恶感，一小部分人即使产生的优越感，他们也不希望这么公然地言明。因此，不可认知，不是真的不能够认知，而是选择不去认知。

到此，我们只是阐述了价值的不可认知，那么，什么叫价值的可认知呢？ 比如，LV包包的价值可认知，就是，它的做工精良，具有艺术感。商业就是将不可认知的LV包包象征社会地位优越，转化为可认知的LV包包做工精良，具有艺术感。

不可认知并非先天形成的，是后天形成的，而一旦是后天形成的，一般便可以改变。因此，倘若成功改变解释不可认知的方法，便可以产生消费动力。比如，将蛇皮袋象征社地位低下，转化为对底层人民的同情之类的话语，这也是之前LV此类奢侈品牌的成功的营销策略。

现代经济

如今，货币就是商品本身，而且是一种只需要印刷成本的商品。但是普通人认为货币依旧充当商品交换的中间物，即物品——货币——物品，实际上现代经济中货币主体化了，即：货币——物品——货币。

货币不再仅仅充当中介的地位，不再仅仅是对应实在之物的存在。货币声称对应着黄金、政府公信力等，实际都只是增强我们对于货币的信心，使我们相信货币十分重要，促进我们努力工作。

机械取代人工最终会导致企业的利润下降？

从长时间看，机械取代人工会导致企业的利润下降。这是为什么呢？机械在购买时参与商品流通，这只是短暂的，之后的长时间内，机械往往不参与商品流通，充当着固定资本。倘若机械过度的取代人工，人相当于失业，之后的事情便遵循经济危机的同一套逻辑。而世界想要维持，经济危机必须解决，在此情况下，便会产生一个乌托邦社会。人失业其实不是关键，人缺少钱才是关键，为了让人有钱，必须发钱。而这钱的数目是恐怖的，单单依靠政府是难以为继的，因此企业必须发钱，一个强有力的政权便是约束企业的。马克思之所以认为，世界将会是共产主义，从经济上看也是因为这个原因。但是，实际上，倘若企业在兼并或者竞争的过程中，不识大局的企业被淘汰了，那么识大局的企业便可以自发组织起来，向居民发钱。实际上，他们联合起来的团体可以视为新的政府。

所以，总得来说，马克思是正确的，但是如果根据我们对共产主义的认识，他也是错误的。在我们看来，共产代表着完全平均主义，但是从上面的两种情况我们可以看出，一定存在强有力的自发组织起来的政府型组织，他们的存在便是不平均的来源，这是符合现实的。而我们所幻想的共产主义，实际上，如同我在后文所提到的仓鼠与理性的起源，都是个体的幻想以及无休止的欲望。有人可能会问，如果这个政府型组织不是人呢？ 同理，根据仓鼠的例子，人不会将自己的权力拱手相让，当然，这个欲望会掩盖成许许多多的其他东西，比如人权、人文主义，所以去中心化不可行。

关于赚取货币的传统观念是否有问题？

在我们传统的观念中，我们认为个人能够赚更多的钱是因为那个人运用聪明的头脑创造额外的物质价值，这个理论以前是正确的，现在只是局部正确，它可以用来解释，不同的普通打工人赚取钱的数量差异。

事实上，在金钱具有主体性的背景下，巨富从来不是依靠这个逻辑赚取大额的财富，但可能是依靠这个逻辑发家。

我记得一个悲哀的故事：买套房子，需要三代人的努力。实际上，这些人从不思索，自己长久以来接受的东西是否正确？钱是否真的是这样来的？在错误的世界里，再努力也是错误的，正如后文所说的仓鼠。

比如，中国开发的房子很多，但卖的数量很少，可房地产依旧能够热热闹闹，这是因为房子不是用来卖的，而是用来创造贷款的，举个例子，从银行贷款5亿，花2亿去投资开发房子，3亿投资别的东西或者套现，开发的房子炒成10亿，然后用市值10亿房子抵押给银行，不仅防止先前贷款的违约，还能够贷更多的钱，这就是房地产企业钱生钱的逻辑，而国家会发行更多的货币，抹去多出的钱，维持经济的运转。国家若不能填补多出来的货币，房地产企业会因为贷不出流动资金倒闭，与大众所想相反，这对聪明的房地产开发商毫无影响。其它许多产业也是如此。

货币主体化的本质

货币主体化的背后是语言主体化，本来文字是思想的中介，但如今变成，思想是文字的中介，文字反而占据了主导地位，思想退而其次，于是通过文字的力量，我们无从得知思想的异化，许多中介物反而主体化的根源便是此

一个语言主体化的害处：许多人过着千篇一律的生活，反而宣称事实就是这样。

一个语言主体化的好处：我们国家之所以由如此强的凝聚力，是将人-国家-人，变为了国家-人-国家，这个现象，我是赞同的，有利于国家凝聚力。

为什么许多哲学家告诉我们需要与理性保持距离？

许多哲学家深刻洞见许多事物脱离中介物成为主体的现象后，告诉我们需要与理性保持距离，实际上，他们的出发点是对的，但是他们也是用着他们不赞同的理性分析自己，所以结论不完全可信。

我们不是要与理性保持距离。而是将世界分为系统世界与生活世界，系统世界是由工具理性所统领的，有统一标准，而生活世界的理性是没有统一标准的。本来，系统世界与生活世界发展水平接近，但是科技革命带来的一系列效用，导致系统世界将生活世界远远甩在身后，系统世界渗入了生活世界，潜移默化地使人认为生活中的问题总是有一个统一的标准。

我们提到价值的不可知不断转化为可认知的过程的意义。那么这对我们其它事情有影响吗？

更进一步，不可知性一般来源于内在，但这个内在往往具有比较色彩，而可知性更是人在社会语境下构建的，更加具有比较色彩，由此，我们可以导出，我之所以这样，是因为别人不是这样。以幸福为例，我之所以幸福，是因为别人不幸福；我之所以健康，是因为别人不健康。这个逻辑便是消费动力的根本基础。因为这个逻辑类似商业的逻辑，因此，二者可以结合起来，于是变成了，人与人的关系镶嵌在物与物的关系内部，这就是所谓的物化

马克思认为有一种形而上的信仰作为经济的基础，是否正确？

实际上，我认为这个第三者在当今表现为系统世界的理性。许多哲学家经过充分论证后认为系统世界的理性是宗教式的。我认为，用系统世界的理性分析一切的动力来自人类从古至今都具有取代神所代表的权力的欲望。我们用系统世界的理性对理性起源的欲望进行打压与否认，使系统世界的理性看上去越来越脱离人性，但同时，打压而无法灭绝，反而激发欲望的力量，使其得以真正有效地运行起来。

此外，这种形而上的第三者具有回指性逻辑。我们购买一个商品，不知道为什么它具有这个价格，但就是想买，感觉它就是值这个价格。这正如同，你问一个信仰上帝的人，为什么信仰上帝，较为理性且无法辩驳的回答是上帝会告诉他为什么。上帝与金钱都具有同样的回指性的逻辑，即，为什么是A，因为A可以告诉我为什么。金钱因此具有了神圣性，而它具有的污秽性其实与宗教起初对金钱的鄙弃有关，中国是儒教，国外主要是罗马帝国时期的基督教。

为什么许多人为市场失序现象感到痛苦？

我们的系统世界的理性，为我们营造一个“前定和谐”的市场的幻想，同时，我们的欲望使我们作为虚伪又迷信的犬儒分子，来攫取人生的资本。这也是为什么许多人对金钱怀有既鄙夷又向往的矛盾心理、许多人经历挫折后相信金钱即正义。

可惜的是，这些人正如仓鼠在圆柱形的容器内部奔跑，他们认为自己十分努力，但依旧失败，不能成功攫取金钱，怨天怨地，怨自己没机会，但是，我们不妨转换视角，从外部看仓鼠的奔跑，他——始终没有产生位移，白费功夫。在此，我认为，倘若想跳出牢笼，必须打破局限的理性，仰观宇宙之大，俯察品类之盛。

成功依靠个人的努力吗？

将时间维度拉大，在我们发觉某件事情之前，我们都是被那些我们不知道、无法感知的事情所塑造。这也能够解释为什么人的成功，他所宣称的才华所占较小，机遇所占很大。我们在迷雾般的世界行走，我们认为是因为我们的努力导致我们躲开了所走路上的坑，确实如此，但是，是迷雾消散导致你先能够看得见路，因此，是看不见的路塑造了看的见的路，最终塑造了我们的人生，这对于任何事情都极具指导意义。上学不是仅仅学知识，因为这条路许多人走过，你只能费劲心力地跳过坑，还收获一份可悲的自我满足，实际上，我们学习是探索未知，走别人没走过的路，当然，这只是语言，真正的思维难以传达，而思维才是判断现实的能力。

杂言

极其简陋的经济危机的逻辑模型

经济危机的本质是因为大部分人的消费能力下降，什么叫消费能力？消费，顾名思义，即购买，也即金钱的流动，而流动起来的叫钱，流动不了的叫纸。一般而言，在此情况下企业的产品销售量减少，导致企业利润下降，为了保证企业收入大于支出，在无特殊情况下，只能进行裁员，就业率下降，大部分人的消费能力进一步下降，产生了恶性循环，最终出现经济危机。

新冠疫情对经济的影响的逻辑

新冠疫情长时间地肆虐，使得许多经济体长期亏损，特别是实体经济，比如许多酒店、餐饮企业面临收缩、倒闭的风险，短时间内，他们可以依靠短期贷款 + 国家宅心仁厚、英明神武的债务减免来过渡，但是千里之堤溃于蚁穴，长期地亏损，使得资产总价值下降，开始出现资不抵债的情况。

而这对房地产企业也有一定影响，为什么呢？ 倘若人们逛商场的频率减少，而根据市场经济，商业地产价值一般是下降的。接下来，我们谈谈这对于居民住房的影响。受到传统观念的影响，中国居民的贷款意愿高度依赖房产价格和收入预期，产生的现象有“房炒不住”等。这几年，降薪成为热议话题，这个话题背后有许多因素，这些因素使人们的收入预期下降，因此对偿还贷款能力的预期会下降，导致买房的需求断崖式下滑，甚至提前还贷。我们将目光转移至政府，如前文所言，政府为了不让实体经济崩溃，做出了巨大的努力，这是大家有目共睹的，而政府财政主要来源就是税收，在大规模债务减免情况下，不论是沿海城市还是内陆城市，政府收入断崖式下滑

上述现象表明，许许多多的微观经济体都出现困难，在中国，政府作为最后的底线，也难以为继。我们物理学上有共振现象，振动不是单独存在的，是可以叠加的，这也适用于经济领域。当足够多的微观经济体产生困难时，一场经济危机将席卷世界。

我们知道，这场经济危机并没有发生。

假如它发生了，过程是什么呢？首先，我们必须明确贷款不是空手套白狼，而是需要有抵押的，以房地产为例子，它们在经济稳定时价值很高，如同泡沫折射阳光般光彩耀眼，但亦如梦幻泡影，容易破灭。当这些泡沫破裂时，资产价格大幅下跌，导致抵押物的价值小于贷款金额，使人们被迫减少贷款，减少消费，产生连锁反应，导致整个国家经济的衰退。

为什么它没有发生呢？ 以政府为例，中国拥有强有力的政府，虽然某些方面的确做的不好，但是在危机面前，会产生无法想象的力量。何出此言呢？

首先，以海洋对面的国家为例，许多人认为罗斯福新政之所以比胡佛的有效果，最重要的一个原因在于，罗斯福建立了一个强力政府，政策能够推行下去。其次，以我国宝贵而有力的经验为证，我们实际已经经历过许多类似的事情，在受损较少下度过了。

我国政府解决紧经济危机的常见手段——基建

我们先谈论拆迁型基建。

拆迁型基建是指，地方政府组织拆迁，发钱给拆迁户，拆迁户拿到了拆迁款，继续买房，开发商因此拿到钱，有了钱，开发商就又开始买地建房，买地的钱归地方政府，因此缓解了地方政府的财政压力，而地方政府又可以拿钱去组织其它项目。其它项目也大体遵循此规则，因此，居民，企业，政府形成良性循环

但有得必有失，每次拆迁型基建，许多项目都与房地产绑在一起，因为土地是不动产，是有限的，而一般而言，物品越来越少，价值越来越高，因此导致房价在拆迁型基建后上涨严重。正如将水坝不断筑高，从下游看，相安无事，但从上游看，水所积累的压力越来远大，一旦堤坝崩溃，大洪水将席卷大地，拆迁型基建只是将压力积攒起来，并未消除压力，因为高额的房价，阻碍人在房地产行业进行消费，阻碍金钱的流动，而拆迁型基建中十分重要的一环是居民需要将钱花出去，因此拆迁型基建难以为继。

那我们能否投资其它类型的基建呢，比如修建高速公路，高铁，地铁等。我们国家确实是这样做的，从短期来看确实可以创造就业岗位，促进钱在居民、政府、企业之间流动，产生类似拆迁型基建的效果，同时，居民不用承担购买这些建筑的使命，咋眼一看貌似很好，但是，实际上，随着这些建筑的使用，需要不断修缮，政府需要承担这个问题，压力不是消失了，而是转移了。如果这些建筑地处沿海，客流量大，还是十分可能回本的。但是，沿海城市对于这些重量级建筑是建无可建或者短时间还产生极大的负面效应，唯有西部可以承担修建这些建筑的占地成本。下面，我们以贵州修建高速公路为例，崇山峻岭，修建难度高，导致修建成本高，有些路段甚至一公里三亿人民币，而贵州地处偏僻，车流量少，高速公路的收益少，根本无法用收入维持后续的修缮费用，更不用说收回当初的营建费用。水利工程、环境保护、图书馆、博物馆等也是同样的道理。

难道基建不行了吗？ 不，基建还是可以进行的，只是得换个策略，进行精细化基建，不是像之前一样着重大城市，也不是着重铁路、公路、机场，而是着重于小县城产业园区、市政道路、防洪排涝设施等，这其中反应了，我国大城市与小城市之间的政治、经济矛盾，我国小县城创造的GDP较大，而基础设施投资量较少。

我国政府解决紧经济危机的常见手段——发展新兴科技

我认为能源技术、物质输运技术、信息技术，都是未来科技的中坚力量，三者互为反哺关系，若论谁最为重要，我认为是能源技术，因为生产力不可能凭空出现，若有产生，必有消耗，产生越多，消耗越多，此处必须注明，能源问题包括如何高效利用能源，因此我们虽然消耗越多，但从宏观上，消耗的质量不一定变多。

经济危机有机遇吗？

概括来说，每次经济危机都是一次巨大的杠杆。

回顾日本的经济危机

1990 年，日本经济泡沫破裂，资产价格一落千丈，要还的债务却一点没少，这让日本的总负债与资产之间的窟窿达到1500 万亿日元，相当于日本三年的 GDP。当时的日本出现了一大批资不抵债的公司，正常情况下，公司破产清算，但是他们又都神奇地活着。为什么呢？虽然资不抵债，但得益于当时全球化的大环境，日本的企业此时有优秀的技术和开发热门产品的能力，世界各地的消费者对日本产品仍然充满旺盛的需求。公司的产品销售仍然强劲，公司持续运营并没有什么问题。那既然公司状态良好，还在持续盈利，这些企业纷纷做了同一个选择，那就是赚了钱就赶紧还债。银行想让企业继续贷款经营，这些企业都欠债欠怕了，企业家们都想着无债一身轻。对于一家企业来说这无可厚非，但都这么做的时候就导致了整个国家的信贷严重收缩，经济陷入颊势，资产负债衰退发生。

80 年代的日本借贷消费的工薪阶层都敢买价格堪比纽约的公寓，转眼间，一朝被蛇咬，半年怕井绳，整个国家从爱欠债变成了怕欠债。年轻人们则用不借房贷、不婚姻、不生育和不创业，来告诉他们的国家，对于未来他们不看好。日本也想救市，但是这个时候普通的货币政策已经失灵，只要没人愿意借钱，哪怕日本把利率降到了零，银行每天给企业打电话求着贷款，也无济于事。债务沉重的企业是不会因为贷款成本低而继续借贷的，所以银行的钱无法借出也就不会被花费。银行的储备金滞留在了银行，而这样的经济衰退会进一步挤压资产价值，结果就是一步一步将经济引向恶性循环。房价和股价都起不来日本2001年到2006年，向整个银行系统注入25 万亿日元的资金，相当于法定准备金的5 倍，私营部门却不为所动。当时的调查显示有66.9%的日本人表示没有创业意愿，在33 个国家地区里排名倒数第一，另外有32%的日本人表示会考虑”在新兴企业工作，也是倒数第一。此时财政政策成为了救市的关键，日本政府只能大量发行国债来实施财政赤字。说白了，就是没人借钱是吧，我政府来借借，来的钱干什么呢？大规模的投资基建，钱从哪儿来呢？就从商业银行来，同时发布政策宣布给所有的银行贷款做担保，防止大规模的挤兑潮出现，从此，日本的 GDP、物价和就业基本稳定了下来。但是副作用也很明显，日本的政府债务是全世界最高的，高达 GDP的2.6倍。财政收入的三成都要还利息，在接下来的15 年里，日本政府通过三轮痛苦的去杠杆，才逐渐修复房地产的资产负债表。日本陷入了长时间的增长停滞。

[^“回顾日本的经济危机”自然段，来自哔哩哔哩某博主，忘了名字，如果该博主看到，请用邮件联系我]:

entry.title: 坚决拥护中国共产党
entry.content:
伟大、光荣、正确的中国共产党万岁!

伟大、光荣、英雄的中国人民万岁！

党章总纲规定：中国共产党以马克思列宁主义、毛泽东思想、邓小平理论、“三个代表”重要思想和科学发展观、习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想作为自己的行动指南

博主在此声明，博主以马克思列宁主义、毛泽东思想、邓小平理论、“三个代表”重要思想和科学发展观、习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想作为自己的行动指南

本文若与党的章程不一致时，以党的章程为准

[TOC]

在百年间，中国共产党将中国从军阀横行、列强肆虐、腐朽落后的旧中国建设为世界第二大经济体。我们需要了解以下事实

坚决拥护中国共产党

曾有数百个团体试图救中国，只有共产党成功了。

1911 年中国最后一个封建王朝被推翻，但革命者却没能建立起强有力的政府。到了1913年底，已出现312 个具备近代政党性质的新兴团体，他们将各种西方政体和思潮都拿来尝试，却都因为不适合中国国情而先后失败。1921 年成立时，中国共产党只有50 多名党员，在一个世纪里，她的成员数量增加到超9500 万名，成为世界上最大政党。

中国共产党结束了百年屈辱史

1840 年腐朽清廷输掉了英国发动的鸦片战争，此后100年，几乎所有的帝国主义国家都侵略过中国。中国共产党奋战28 年，恢复了国家的独立与统一，让人民重获尊严。

中国共产党解决了土地分配不平等的问题

在1930 的江西农村，只占有农民人口3.4%的大小地主，拥有的土地是其余所有农民拥有土地的总和。据统计，1949年中国近90%的国民都是乡村人口。中国共产党发动了土地革命，让耕者有其田。到1952年，占全国耕地面积46.5%的土地被重新分配，约3 亿中国农民通过土改获得了土地。

中国共产党为中国制定了长远发展目标
